title: German Engineer in Sri Lanka develops battery-powered three-wheeler; A solution to the fuel crisis
body_lines: COLOMBO (News 1st); A German engineer living in Sri Lanka has developed a three-wheeler that runs on batteries, which he says is a solution to the fuel crisis faced by Sri Lankans.
The German Engineer who is currently in Sri Lanka on holiday and living in Kundasale, Kandy noted that for this project expand, the Sri Lankan government must intervene and support such efforts.
With a full charge of 4 to 5 hours, the three-wheeler can operate for around 70 to 80 kilometers.
